<p> VRML97 and ClassicVRML encodings use the term EXTERNPROTO, while XML and JSON encodings use the ExternProtoDeclare element. </p> <p> ExternProtoDeclare refers to a ProtoDeclare node declaration provided in another file. ExternProtoDeclare interfaces are defined by field statements (without IS/connect statements). <i>Hint:</i> ExternProtoDeclare is a definition only, add corresponding ProtoInstance nodes to create new instances. </p> <p> VRML97 and ClassicVRML encodings simply uses the prototype name to create an instance node, while XML and JSON encodings use the ProtoInstance element. </p> <p> ProtoInstance creates an instance node of a locally or externally declared prototype definition. ProtoDeclare/ExternProtoDeclare definitions are abstract, corresponding ProtoInstance nodes are concrete. ProtoInstance nodes typically contain fieldValue statements to override default field values defined in the original ProtoDeclare statement. <i>Hint:</i> the node type of a ProtoInstance exactly matches the first node in the corresponding ProtoDeclare/ProtoBody declaration. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ExternProtoDeclare" target="_blank">ExternProtoDeclare</a> statement, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#field" target="_blank">field</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoDeclare" target="_blank">ProtoDeclare</a> statement, and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoInstance" target="_blank">ProtoInstance</a> node with <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#fieldValue" target="_blank">fieldValue</a> statement. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html" target="_blank">Core component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#Concepts" target="_blank">7.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#EXTERNPROTOStatement" target="_blank">7.2.5.9 EXTERNPROTO statement</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter31Prototypes" target="_blank">Chapter 31 Prototypes</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter14Prototypes" target="_blank">Chapter 14 Prototypes</a> </li> </ul>
